trans-unit.source: Manage your StorSimple volume containers | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage your StorSimple volume containers | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Explains how you can use the StorSimple Manager service volume containers page to add, modify, or delete a volume container.
trans-unit.target: Explains how you can use the StorSimple Manager service volume containers page to add, modify, or delete a volume container.

trans-unit.source: Use the StorSimple Manager service to manage StorSimple volume containers
trans-unit.target: Use the StorSimple Manager service to manage StorSimple volume containers

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how to use the StorSimple Manager service to create and manage StorSimple volume containers.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how to use the StorSimple Manager service to create and manage StorSimple volume containers.

trans-unit.source: A volume container in a Microsoft Azure StorSimple device contains one or more volumes that share storage account, encryption, and bandwidth consumption settings.
trans-unit.target: A volume container in a Microsoft Azure StorSimple device contains one or more volumes that share storage account, encryption, and bandwidth consumption settings.

trans-unit.source: A device can have multiple volume containers for all its volumes.
trans-unit.target: A device can have multiple volume containers for all its volumes.

trans-unit.source: A volume container has the following attributes:
trans-unit.target: A volume container has the following attributes:

trans-unit.source: **Volumes** – The thinly provisioned StorSimple volumes that are contained within the volume container.
trans-unit.target: **Volumes** – The thinly provisioned StorSimple volumes that are contained within the volume container.

trans-unit.source: A volume container may contain up to 256 thinly provisioned StorSimple volumes.
trans-unit.target: A volume container may contain up to 256 thinly provisioned StorSimple volumes.

trans-unit.source: **Encryption** – An encryption key that can be defined for each volume container.
trans-unit.target: **Encryption** – An encryption key that can be defined for each volume container.

trans-unit.source: This key is used for encrypting the data that is sent from your StorSimple device to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This key is used for encrypting the data that is sent from your StorSimple device to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: A military-grade AES-256 bit key is used with the user-entered key.
trans-unit.target: A military-grade AES-256 bit key is used with the user-entered key.

trans-unit.source: To secure your data, we recommend that you always enable cloud storage encryption.
trans-unit.target: To secure your data, we recommend that you always enable cloud storage encryption.

trans-unit.source: **Storage account** – The storage account that is linked to your cloud storage service provider.
trans-unit.target: **Storage account** – The storage account that is linked to your cloud storage service provider.

trans-unit.source: All the volumes residing in a volume container share this storage account.
trans-unit.target: All the volumes residing in a volume container share this storage account.

trans-unit.source: You can choose a storage account from an existing list, or create a new account when you create the volume container and then specify the access credentials for that account.
trans-unit.target: You can choose a storage account from an existing list, or create a new account when you create the volume container and then specify the access credentials for that account.

trans-unit.source: **Cloud bandwidth** – The bandwidth consumed by the device when the data from the device is being sent to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: **Cloud bandwidth** – The bandwidth consumed by the device when the data from the device is being sent to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: You can enforce a bandwidth control by specifying a value between 1 and 1000 Mbps when you define this container.
trans-unit.target: You can enforce a bandwidth control by specifying a value between 1 and 1000 Mbps when you define this container.

trans-unit.source: If you want the device to consume all available bandwidth, set this field to Unlimited.
trans-unit.target: If you want the device to consume all available bandwidth, set this field to Unlimited.

trans-unit.source: You can also create and apply a bandwidth template to allocate bandwidth based on schedule.
trans-unit.target: You can also create and apply a bandwidth template to allocate bandwidth based on schedule.

trans-unit.source: Volume containers page
trans-unit.target: Volume containers page

trans-unit.source: This following procedures explain how to use the StorSimple **Volume containers** page to complete the following common operations:
trans-unit.target: This following procedures explain how to use the StorSimple **Volume containers** page to complete the following common operations:

trans-unit.target: Add a volume container

trans-unit.target: Modify a volume container

trans-unit.target: Delete a volume container

trans-unit.target: Add a volume container

trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to create a volume container.

trans-unit.target: Modify a volume container

trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to modify a volume container.

trans-unit.source: Delete a volume container
trans-unit.target: Delete a volume container

trans-unit.source: A volume container has volumes within it.
trans-unit.target: A volume container has volumes within it.

trans-unit.source: It can be deleted only if all the volumes contained in it are first deleted.
trans-unit.target: It can be deleted only if all the volumes contained in it are first deleted.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to delete a volume container.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to delete a volume container.
